That's not compensation, that's a refund. Let me put it this way. You want to go to a sports game and pay to go to the game, buy tickets for your friends, get time off work, restructure your weekend to go this game, and then when you wake up the day that this big game is happening, it's cancelled. But you get the money you paid for an event that didn't happen back! Wow, so generous! This is a classic example of placing too much importance on basic things. So what, they gave back money that was spent on something that didn't happen? Oh, big deal! There's a big difference between compensation and a refund, that being that compensation is when you _**give**_ a reward for troubles, whereas a refund is where you _**give back **_ for an incompetent service/product. Key word there being "give" and "give back".  This issue falls under the "give back" category as there was no "give", players were only given back what they had paid.
What a suprise....

I never got a clash ticket, sadly cause out of like 20 mates that used to play league I'm now 1 of 2 (i don't wanna team up with randoms). surely no link to riot being one of the most disappointing game companies out there, they must have just got bored of the game. but that's just a side note. what I'm trying to get at, is that I wouldn't benefit at all from any compensation yet I'm still looking at this with a dropped jaw. 1. because their games only gonna slowly die and has probably already started to by now and 2. because its just bad business. you really wanna have no one win from this sitch riot? lol, I can't believe they would still stinge the fuck out of the community after a monumental fuck up. you don't make this big of a mistake where, you've genuinely upset a large portion of a region, including the players that were willing to come back to the game for the event, and then take a stand against the protests, like 'fuck that noise we'll get more money from them if we don't hand out any compensation' which is what riot will find to be fools gold. people are struggling to still enjoy the game, don't give them a reason to leave as if the other games out there rn aren't enough. no clue if its something to do with oce not being important enough in their eyes or its just purely their greed getting in the way, but its terrible business either way, there are almost 1k skins in the game and a shard = like half of a skin or like 1/3 what the kinda harm could that do to your money making scheme riot, they'll no doubt get an ugly af looking legacy skin for a champ they never play thats probably worth 520rp (going off my hextech luck). getting a staff member to write up a sincere apology was a great idea and also expected from a company of such scale but it hasn't fixed the broken trust with the wallets that fuel you. i mean id be fucked off if i didnt go out on my friday night just so i could give and then get back the 900 blue essence i spent on a bugged out game mode.

disclaimer - in no way do i wanna sound like a rito basher. especially when clash sounds like such a great game mode that i hope happens more regularly so i can convince my mates to get back into league. but i feel like this is too much of a hype crusher to leave without a lil pick-me-up present for the massive inconvenience to some. oh and those saying riots not a charity, we know that, but its the price to keep people happy. especially cause weve all witnessed how toxic the community can be its convincing enough to let a few penny's go
